wikipedia_page.main: Michael Edwards (born 10 September 1974) is a former English footballer, who played as a midfielder in the Football League and Championship for Tranmere Rovers F.C., Mansfield Town F.C., Darlington F.C, Shamrock Rovers F.C., Stalybridge Celtic F.C., Northwich Victoria F.C., Vauxhall Motors F.C., Rhyl FC, and Caernarfon Town F.C..

response: Michael or Mike Edwards may refer to:
*Mike Edwards (footballer, born 1980), Notts County F.C. footballer
*Mike Edwards (high jumper) (born 1990), British-Nigerian athlete and winner at the 2018 British Indoor Athletics Championships
*Mike Edwards (second baseman) (born 1952), Major League Baseball second baseman, 1977–1980
*Mike Edwards (third baseman) (born 1976), Major League Baseball infielder/outfielder, 2003–2006
*Mike Edwards (musician) (1948–2010), cellist of the band Electric Light Orchestra
*Mike Edwards (journalist), Scottish journalist for Scotland Today
